title: First responders deliver 2 Christmas babies in Greater Boston
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News EMTs helped a mother deliver a baby boy in Medford, and police officers assisted a mother in Stoughton on Christmas Day.
Stoughton Police Headquarters.
Pat Greenhouse/Boston Globe First responders in two Massachusetts communities helped deliver newborn babies on Christmas Day.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce signing of forward Amanda Allen

title: One last look at 2025: Read our favorite stories of the year
author: Zipporah Osei
bullets: Tell Us Revisit the stories that defined 2025 one more time.
2025 gave Boston plenty to talk about.
Some stories surprised us, some sparked debate, and others reminded us why we love covering this city.

title: 21-year-old woman dies in massive Christmas Eve fire at Needham home
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Needham police called the fire “an unimaginable tragedy” and said “the time will come” for donations and other support.
Firefighters worked at the scene of a house fire on Woodworth Road in Needham on Wednesday morning.
Natick Fire Department A large early-morning Christmas Eve fire killed a 21-year-old woman at a Needham home, officials said.

title: Officials warn about possible measles exposures in Boston and Westborough
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Health A visitor with measles flew into Logan Airport in Boston on Dec.
11 and stayed overnight at a hotel in Westborough, officials said.
A single dose of the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR) vaccine.
